entry.content:
Mar 31, 09:12 UTC
Resolved - The intervention was successfully completed last night at 16:00 UTC

Start time : 30/03/2022 06:00 UTC

Mar 31, 07:50 UTC

Mar 30, 22:38 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 29/03/2022 08:00 UTC
End Time : 30/03/2022 13:07 UTC
Service impact : The supervision service (BLF) is once again operational on the A infrastructure. The migration operations carried out by our team have allowed to perpetuate the resolution by reducing the load on the machine.
Root cause : An overload was the root cause of this issue.
Current status : Resolved

Mar 30, 12:56 UTC
Monitoring - Migration operations are underway. We do not observe any more alarms for the moment and services are going up.
We are monitoring the evolution of the situation

Mar 30, 09:44 UTC
Update - Ongoing actions : To improve the load distribution of our supervision infrastructure, we migrate services to other infrastructures

We apologise for any inconveniency caused.

Mar 30, 09:27 UTC
Update - Ongoing actions: Our teams are making a robot to do the migration. The purpose of rebot is to correct the load problem we have.

Mar 29, 16:14 UTC
Update - Update : Our team is planning a migration tonight to restore the service. We will keep you informed of the progress.

Mar 29, 14:07 UTC
Identified - Start time : 29/03/2022 08:00 UTC

entry.title: [Spain][VOIP] - Interconnect
entry.content:
Mar 28, 15:28 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 08/03/2022 15:04 UTC
End Time : 28/03/2022 10:15 UTC
Service impact : Our Spanish subscribers can make and receive calls. This was due to an issue on the equipment of our remote Spanish provider. Following the operations carried out on the configuration of the equipment of our partner Telefonica, the service of the interconexion is completely restored. Thank you.
Current status : Resolved

Mar 25, 15:52 UTC
Update - We continue to work with our partner to restore the interconnection.
We have observed some temporary recovery of the service following operations on their part.
We will keep you informed of the evolution of the interventions

Mar 22, 09:43 UTC
Update - We have checked and corrected the circuit with our partner. Our partner will check the interconnection between our link and theirs. In addition we ask for an analysis from our hardware supplier. We will keep you informed of the next evolution of the situation

Mar 21, 13:43 UTC
Update - Ongoing actions : Our teams were working with our partner to change some voice interconnection resource.
We saw an improvement which is not significant. So our teams will continue to work on the problem.

Mar 18, 10:46 UTC
Update - Ongoing actions : Our teams are planning another intervention with the provider today to investigate further

Mar 17, 16:11 UTC
Update - Ongoing actions :An intervention on site with the provider is actually ongoing.

Mar 11, 12:35 UTC
Update - Ongoing actions : We are continuing our investigations/operations.
We are aware of the long recovery time and are doing everything possible to restore your service as soon as possible

Mar 9, 08:38 UTC
Update - Ongoing actions : The investigation operations which are on the side of our operator in Spain resumed this morning. We apologize for the inconvenience caused.

Mar 8, 17:24 UTC
Update - Ongoing actions : Our technical teams continue to investigate in collaboration with our operator to restore the service quickly.

Mar 8, 15:19 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 08/03/2022 15:04 UTC
Service impact : Our spanish subscribers can make calls but they can not receive calls for the moment. This is due to an issue on the equipment of our remote spanish provider.
Ongoing actions : Our technical teams are currently work in hands with the provider to restore the service rapidly.

entry.title: [Dordogne/France][Internet Access] - xDSL
entry.content:
Mar 18, 16:26 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 15/03/2022 15:30 UTC
End Time : 18/03/2022 10:45 UTC
Service impact : Some subscriber connection nodes (SNNs) are affected by loss of connections.
Root cause : A default on the operator's infrastructure was the cause of this issue. the defect has now been corrected.
Current status : Resolved

Mar 17, 07:29 UTC
Monitoring - Start time : 15/03/2022 15:30 UTC
Service impact : Some subscriber connection nodes (SNNs) were affected by loss of connections.
Ongoing actions : An adduction of the Bergerac (24) collection router was involved, it has been deactivated to stabilize the links. There is no more impact to be expected. The links remain under surveillance and the optical module will be changed. We will keep you informed soon.

Mar 16, 15:01 UTC
Update - Update : We have identified LDP tunnel bugs (tunnel in charge of access authentication) on our DSLAM cluster between PÃ©rigueux and Bordeaux. Investigations are underway to resolve this behavior.

Mar 16, 10:29 UTC
Update - Update : Actions are underway to determine the equipment generating this behavior. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Mar 15, 17:22 UTC
Identified - Start time : 15/03/2022 15:30 UTC
Service impact : Some subscriber connection nodes (SNNs) are affected by loss of connections.
Ongoing actions : We have re-launched the provider to resolve the incident. We are sorry for the inconvenience.
